author: mklement0
body:
See also: 
* #11338
* #13550

# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

PowerShell has a wealth of operators, many of them with sophisticated functionality, even in the case of operators familiar from other languages (e.g., `*` offering not just numeric multiplication, but also string replications).

To take full advantage of them, consulting the documentation is necessary, yet this documentation is currently hard to discover.

`Get-Help` should support an easy way to offer _focused_ lookup of the documentation for any given operator, via the operator symbols themselves - ideally by showing / navigation to just the relevant portion of the enclosing `about_*Operators*` page or similar.

# Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

Here's how it _could_ work:

```powershell
# WISHFUL THINKING

# Lists the names of all about_*Operators* topics.
Get-Help -Category Operator

# Opens the help topic (section) for the -replace operator.
# Allow omitting the initial '-'; if you do specify it, quote the entire argument.
Get-Help -Category Operator -Name 'replace'

# For simplicity, if the (positional) -Name argument is unambiguously an operator symbol,
# do not require -Category Operator
# Ignore whitespace in all arguments, so that, e.g., '@( )` works in addition to '@()'
Get-Help '@()'  # -Category Operator implied
Get-Help '-replace'
Get-Help '%'
Get-Help '>'
Get-Help '--%'  # not technically an operator, but we should support it too

# Quotes aren't technically operators, but we should support them too:
# All of these could open the about_Quoting_Rules topic.
Get-Help '"' # or: '""'
Get-Help "'" # or: "''"
Get-Help "@'" # or: "@''@"
Get-Help '@"' # or: '@""@'

# Ambiguous symbols
Get-Help '[]' # either default to indexer over casts / type constraints, or list both to force disambiguation
Get-Help '[0]' # interpret as indexer; also: Get-Help '["foo"]' 
Get-Help '[int]' # interpret as cast / type constraint; any non-numeric unquoted name should work

Get-Help '.' # default to member-access over dot-sourcing; print hint for how to look up dot-sourcing
Get-Help '. ' # dot-sourcing (trailing space disambiguates)

Get-Help '&' # default to call operator over background operator, print hint for how to look up the background operator
Get-Help ' &' # background operator (leading space disambiguates)

Get-Help '@' # default to splatting, but print hint for how to look up @() and @'...'@
```

It would also be helpful to be able to output a concise table of operators, along the following lines:

```powershell
# Not sure what the best syntax is here; maybe include it in about_Operators with links to
# the operator-specific descriptions.
# Note the 'LookupName' column which shows how to resolve ambiguities.
PS> Get-Help about_OperatorTable
```
```none
Name         FriendlyName                                Category        LookupName
----         ------------                                --------        ----------
--%          stop-parsing symbol                         ArgumentPassing
@            splatting                                   ArgumentPassing
-            subtraction / sign inversion                Arithmetic
*            multiplication / string replication         Arithmetic
...
+            addition / string concatenation              Arithmetic
,            array constructor                           Array
..           range (numbers/characters)                  Array
--           decrement                                   Assignment
-=           compound assignment                         Assignment
...
-band        bitwise AND                                 Bitwise
-bNot        bitwise complement                          Bitwise
...
?:           ternary conditional                         Conditional
??           null-coalescing                             Conditional
-contains    collection contains RHS                     Containment
-in          LHS contained in RHS                        Containment
-notContains collection doesn't contain RHS              Containment
-notIn       LHS not contained in collection             Containment
-eq          equality                                    Equality
-ge          greater-than-or-equal                       Equality
# ...
@()          array-subexpression                         Evaluation
$()          subexpression                               Evaluation
.            (dot-)source                                Execution       '. '
&            background                                  Execution       ' &'
&            call (execute)                              Execution
-and         logical AND                                 Logical
...
```
 

Note:

* For _offline_ use in the _console_, the current help topics aren't structured enough to show the relevant topic _excerpts_ focused just on the specified operator.
  * However, for _online_, _browser-based_ lookups this already works via HTML anchors; e.g., `-replace` is described specifically at https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.core/about/about_Comparison_Operators?view=powershell-7#replacement-operator

  * Some operators don't have individual sections even online, such as the arithmetic operators, but the enclosing topic is then usually short enough to find the information of interest easily.

* For an implementation of this functionality as PowerShell function `Show-OperatorHelp` (focused on operators only and only with _online_ lookup), see [this Stack Overflow answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/59324892/45375).
title: Extend Get-Help to support focused lookup of documentation for PowerShell operators
